page.title: 02Bacup _ an interesting place
page.content: On the road to Burnley(A671) there is a building of historic interest _ an old{GENT'S TOILET.}It is on the corner of Dog Pits Lane,Broadclough and was probably built for the use of workmen at the nearby mill or quarry. On Yorkshire Street,in front of the Health Centre,stand the stocks. They were found in 1974 by workmen digging in Tong Lane. They could take two offenders. Alongside is a grind_stone. It came originally from Sower Hall Quarry near Todmorden and was used to crush sandstone into sand. The town is said to have the smallest street in England. It is Elgin Street and has only one house it is so short. From our study it is clear that Bacup grew rapidly in the hundred or so years before World War One.
